Package de.hu.gralog.graph

This package defines all classes needed to implement Graphs in GraLog.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
GraphWithEditableElements<V,E> This interface need to be implemented by all custom graphobjects.
NestedGraphPropertyBean This class is a helper to define properties that are indexed for graphs, vertices and edges.
SelectionListenableGraph<V,E> This interface extends ViewableGraph in order to make it possible to listen for selectionevents for that graph.
SelectionListener<V,E> A Listener for selectionevents of graphs.
ViewableGraph<V,E> This interface extends ElementListenableGraph, with functions needed to display the Graph with JGraph.
 

Class Summary
DirectedGraph<V extends DefaultListenableVertex,E extends DefaultEdge> This class is a template for directed graphs in GrALoG.
ElementAttributes This static class provides default attributes for Edge- and VertexRenderers.
GraphTypeInfo A GraphTypeInfo acts as a factory for graphs defined in GrALog.
LabeledDirectedGraphTypeInfo This class represents a DirectedGraph with LabeledGraphVertex as vertexClass DefaultEdge as edgeClass and a SIMPLE_GRAPH graph-flavour.
LabeledGraphVertex This class represents a vertex with a label
LabeledUndirectedGraphTypeInfo This class represents an UndirectedGraph with LabeledGraphVertex as vertexClass DefaultEdge as edgeClass and a SIMPLE_GRAPH graph-flavour.
UndirectedGraph<V extends DefaultListenableVertex,E extends DefaultEdge> This class is a template for undirected graphs in GrALoG.
 

Package de.hu.gralog.graph Description

This package defines all classes needed to implement Graphs in GraLog. All graphs in GrALoG are subclasses of DirectedGraph or UndirectedGraph. Since these graphs are typed ( with vertices and edges ) it is usually not necessary to subclass these classes. The only case where this is necessary is if you want your graph to have properties which cannot be stored in vertices or edges. In either case in order to define your own type of graph you have to do the following:

  • define your own graph-class as a subclass of DirectedGraph or UndirectedGraph - this step is optionally
  • define your own vertex / edge classes as subclass of de.hu.gralog.jgrapht.vertex.DefaultListableVertex / de.hu.gralog.jgrapht.edge.DefaultListableEdge - this step is also optional
  • define a TypeInfo-Class for your graph which has to be a subclass of GraphTypeInfo - this step is not optional

Please see the documentation of classes mentioned with these steps for further information.
